Package com.cognizant.utilities

Class BrowserUtils

java.lang.Object
com.cognizant.utilities.BrowserUtils
public class BrowserUtils extends Object
This class contains various methods used by WebDriver instance to work with the web browser.

    • wait

      public static void wait​(org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver driver, int seconds)
      Implicit wait method. Can be used to wait for page's contents to load.
      Parameters:
      driver - Current WebDriver instance.
      seconds - Time in seconds for implicitly waiting on the webpage.

    • waitForElement

      public static void waitForElement​(org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver driver, org.openqa.selenium.By locator) throws org.openqa.selenium.NoSuchElementException, org.openqa.selenium.TimeoutException
      Explicit wait for web elements. This method can be used to explicitly wait for a web element to be present on the current webpage. By default this method waits for 10 seconds for an element to be present in the DOM, after which it'll throw NoSuchElementException and TimeOutException.
      Parameters:
      driver - Current WebDriver instance.
      locator - org.openqa.selenium.By locator for the web element.
      Throws:
      org.openqa.selenium.NoSuchElementException
      org.openqa.selenium.TimeoutException

    • waitForElementFluent

      public static void waitForElementFluent​(org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver driver, org.openqa.selenium.By locator) throws org.openqa.selenium.NoSuchElementException, org.openqa.selenium.TimeoutException
      Fluent Wait for web elements. This method can be used to fluently wait for a web element to be present on the current webpage. By default this methods waits for 10 seconds, after which it'll throw NoSuchElementException and TimeOutException.
      Parameters:
      driver - Current WebDriver instance.
      locator - org.openqa.selenium.By locator for the web element.
      Throws:
      org.openqa.selenium.NoSuchElementException
      org.openqa.selenium.TimeoutException

    • selectByValue

      public static void selectByValue​(org.openqa.selenium.WebElement elem, String value)
      This method can be used to select items in a drop-down-list on a webpage. The second parameter is the String value's name, that you want to select from the drop-down.
      Parameters:
      elem - Drop-down-list's WebElement object.
      value - String value that you want to select from the drop-down-menu.

    • selectByIndex

      public static void selectByIndex​(org.openqa.selenium.WebElement elem, int index)
      This method can be used to select items in a drop-down-list on a webpage. This second parameter is the Integer index, that you want to select from the drop-down.
      Parameters:
      elem - rop-down-list's WebElement object.
      index - Integer index of the item you want to select from the drop-down-menu.

    • actionPressEnter

      public static void actionPressEnter​(org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver driver)
      This method simulates the pressing of Enter key on the keyboard
      Parameters:
      driver - Current WebDriver instance.

    • scrollWindow

      public static void scrollWindow​(org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver driver, int scrollingUnit)
      This method is used to simulate scrolling on the current webpage.
      Parameters:
      driver - Current WebDriver instance.
      scrollingUnit - Integer units to scroll on the page.

    • screenshot

      public static void screenshot​(org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver driver, String filePath) throws IOException
      This method is used to take the screenshots on the current webpage.
      Parameters:
      driver - Current WebDriver instance.
      filePath - Screenshot file save location in String
      Throws:
      IOException

    • getBrowserName

      public static String getBrowserName​(org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver driver)
      Returns the currently simulating browser's String name.
      Parameters:
      driver - Current WebDriver instance.
      Returns:
      String name of the currently automating browser.

    • sendKeys

      public static void sendKeys​(org.openqa.selenium.WebElement elem, String value)
      This method is used to enter String values in text boxes of the browser.
      Parameters:
      elem - TextBox WebElement object.
      value - String text value to enter in the text box.

    • clearKeys

      public static void clearKeys​(org.openqa.selenium.WebElement elem)
      This method is used to clear the text inside a text box in a web page.
      Parameters:
      elem - TextBox WebElement object.
